Class CommandLineCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • CommandLineCalculator

  • public class CommandLineCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class CommandLineCalculator is an arithmetic based expression evaluator that supports: declaring variables, addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, assigning values to variables, and assigning arithmetic expressions to variables.
    Version:
    12/5/2016
    Author:
    Sadie Rynestad, Troy Potvin, and Cortland Lizer

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandLineCalculator

        public CommandLineCalculator()

    • Method Detail

      • calculator

        public java.lang.String calculator(java.lang.String str)
        This method checks that if the String submitted is a valid option, then it checks if it is a variable that needs to be stored. If it is, then it stores it and returns "variable stored" and if neither of those conditions are hit it uses all the other methods in this program to perform the required operations in the order of Parentheses, Multiplication, Division, Addition, Subtraction (PMDAS) and returns the final answer
        Parameters:
        str - the string inputed by the user
        Returns:
        calculatedAnswer the completed answer of the entered equation, if it was a variable return "variable stored", if it was an invalid entry return "invalid entry"

      • storeVariable

        public void storeVariable(java.lang.String str)
        This method checks if the inputed method is a String and is meant to be stored as a variable which is determined by the use of a single "=" symbol. If it is meant to be a variable, then it stores the solved equation and corresponding variable in a hash table.
        Parameters:
        str - the string inputed by the user

      • getVariable

        public java.lang.String getVariable(java.lang.String str)
        This method takes the given string and returns the answer to that given variable. If the string is not a stored variable, then it returns "variable not found"
        Parameters:
        str - the string to be checked if it is a variable and then found in the hash table
        Returns:
        getVar the variables corresponding answer that was in the hash table

      • subtraction

        public double subtraction(java.lang.String x,
                          java.lang.String y)
        This method subtracts the second variable given from the first variable
        Parameters:
        x - the number that you will subtract from
        y - the number that you will subtract from x
        Returns:
        answer the value of (x-y)

      • addition

        public double addition(java.lang.String x,
                       java.lang.String y)
        This method adds the first number to the second number.
        Parameters:
        x - the first number to be added
        y - the second number to be added
        Returns:
        answer of the first number added to the second number (x+y)

      • division

        public double division(java.lang.String x,
                       java.lang.String y)
        This method divides the first number by the second number.
        Parameters:
        x - the number that is being divided
        y - the number that you are dividing by
        Returns:
        answer the first number divided by the second number (x/y)

      • multiplication

        public double multiplication(java.lang.String x,
                             java.lang.String y)
        This method multiplies the first number by the second number
        Parameters:
        x - the first number to be multiplied
        y - the second number to be multiplied
        Returns:
        answer the first number multiplied by the second number (x/y)

      • parentheses

        public java.lang.String parentheses(java.lang.String str)
        This method takes in the given subStrings that is with the two parentheses it then removes the parentheses and sends it back through method calculator and converts that answer to a String to be returned.
        Parameters:
        str - the string inside the parentheses
        Returns:
        strPar value of the substring converted back to a String
